inclusion.criterion: Adults (18 years of age or older)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Any head and neck cancer patient undergoing laryngectomy, neck dissection,
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Inpatient and referred for HNL treatment following surgery
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients with previous chemoradiation therapy or head and neck surgery accepted
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients under the age of 18 years of age
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients who undergo neck dissection surgery that do not present with symptoms of HNL
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients with free tissue transfer reconstruction
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: 62-year-old African-American man presented with left upper and lower extremity weakness, associated with dark visual spot in right eye, right facial numbness, facial drop and slurred speech. He denied dyspnea, headache, palpitations, chest pain, fever, dizziness, bowel or urinary incontinence, loss of consciousness.
